column2: Production Planning: Develop production schedules, allocate resources, and coordinate workflows to meet production targets and customer demands efficiently.      Process Optimization: Implement strategies to improve production processes, enhance productivity, minimize waste, and reduce production costs.      Quality Assurance: Ensure compliance with quality standards, specifications, and regulatory requirements throughout the production and packing processes.      Equipment Maintenance: Coordinate preventive maintenance activities, troubleshoot equipment issues, and ensure that production machinery and packing equipment are in optimal working condition.      Inventory Management: Monitor inventory levels of raw materials, components, and finished goods. Coordinate with procurement and logistics teams to ensure adequate supply chain management.      Safety and Compliance: Enforce safety protocols, identify potential hazards, and implement corrective actions to maintain a safe working environment for employees and comply with regulatory guidelines.      Team Leadership: Supervise production and packing teams, providing guidance, training, and performance feedback to ensure high levels of productivity, morale, and teamwork.      Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process optimization, automation, and innovation to enhance production efficiency, quality, and competitiveness.      Cost Management: Monitor production costs, analyze variances, and identify opportunities to optimize resource utilization and reduce operational expenses.

column2: Deccan Medical Centre is looking for EXECUTIVE - CASH & CREDIT BILLING to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As an Executive in the Cash & Credit Billing department, you will be responsible for managing all aspects of cash transactions and credit billing procedures within the organization      Your primary duties will involve processing payments, reconciling accounts, and ensuring accurate and timely billing to customers      Additionally, you will play a crucial role in maintaining financial records and implementing effective credit control measures to minimize risk and optimize cash flow        Key Responsibilities:        Cash Management:Handle daily cash transactions, including cash receipts, deposits, and disbursements      Monitor cash balances and ensure sufficient funds are available for operational needs      Reconcile cash transactions and resolve any discrepancies promptly      Credit Billing:Generate invoices and credit notes accurately and in a timely manner      Verify the accuracy of billing data and ensure compliance with contractual agreements      Process credit card transactions and monitor payment collections      Handle billing inquiries and resolve customer issues related to billing discrepancies      Account Reconciliation:Reconcile customer accounts to ensure accurate billing and payment application      Investigate and resolve any discrepancies or billing errors promptly      Prepare periodic reconciliation reports for management review      Credit Control:Assess creditworthiness of new customers and establish credit limits in accordance with company policies      Monitor overdue accounts and follow up with customers to secure payments      Implement credit control procedures to minimize bad debt and mitigate financial risk      Reporting and Analysis:Prepare and analyze cash flow forecasts to support financial planning and decision-making      Generate reports on billing activity, cash receipts, and outstanding receivables      Provide insights and recommendations to improve cash management and billing processes      Compliance:Ensure compliance with relevant accounting standards, regulatory requirements, and internal controls      Stay updated on changes in accounting regulations and industry best practices

column2: Skill required:  Order to Cash - Billing Processing Designation:  Order to Cash Operations Associate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years  What would you do? The incumbent should have good knowledge of the Collections lifecycle and will be responsible for  Collection of payments from the customer to achieve the set targets  Ensure timely completion of work allocations related to Collections activities Manage the daily operations-related communications, and interactions with internal & client stakeholders both by e-mails and calls as well.  He/she must have worked in Collections for international clients, and BPO organizations.  Actively participating in client calls and providing required resolution/inputs to leads. Working on the night shift based on business requirements. Optimizing working capital, providing real-time visibility and end-to-end management of revenue and cash flow, and streamlining billing processes. This team over looks the entire processes that starts from customers inquiry, sales order to delivery and invoicing. The Cash Application Processing team focuses on solving queries related to cash applications and coordination with the customers. The role requires a good understanding of cash applications, the process of applying unapplied cash, reconciliation of suspense account in cash application, and process them from payment receipt to finalization.The Billing Processing team focuses on the process of creating and issuing customer invoices. This includes reviewing the list of debit notes raised and identifying any gaps in the process. The role requires a good understanding of invoicing, collections, account receivables, order management, sales order, order processing, order fulfillment, and journal entries. The role may also require following up with the sales team to provide reasons for raising debit notes and un-recognized revenue. What are we looking for? Minimum 2.5-3 years of collections experience in Finance & Accounting function BPO experience will be an added advantage but not mandatory Minimum Bachelor's degree in Finance Accounting or related field  Good knowledge of the AR Collections process. System & applications. Experience working on SAP Hanna 4 & High Radius would be preferred and an added advantage. Sound knowledge of MS Excel & word. Having advanced Excel knowledge would be an added advantage.Communication & Interpersonal skills Ability to interact with customers for daily operational activities with client SME Excellent communication skills both oral and written as needed to interact with customers/internal stakeholders via calls and e-mails. Closely work with team lead to drive process/organizational initiative  Must be able to communicate both orally and in writing to Collections SMEs  Roles and Responsibilities: Collection of payments from the customer via email/ calls Interact with the BU, thereby ensuring follow-up and follow-through, managing collection agencies day to day activities  Follow up with customers for uncleared debts by business rules specified by the client. Prepare collections files and Submit to Collection Agencies  Identify refunds and submit them for approval Must possess good communication skills both e-mail and oral for communicating with customers about unpaid balances Update any contact information in the Collection System Identify customers for write-offs and process approved write-offs Track payment promises and Identify accounts requiring collection letters Submit transfer request for credits to A/R for processing Review and respond to customer queries and communicate with customers for further queries Raise accurate and on-time queries and take necessary actions on resolutions received Perform quality checks for the team members Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Voluntary billing-P&C Account rep., is accountable for end to end billing management for Billing & Remittance customers (P&C). Facilitate a working dialog with Group contacts, stateside account managers, remittance team and internal business partners in order to provide solutions to the client billing needs.                         Essential Functions                         Build and maintain strong relationships with group customers and Internal Partners (Sales, I/T, or systems, marketing, call centers, accounting, etc.). in order to enhance the ongoing success of the B&R beginning at the time of sale.                          Monitor the billing, transmission and payment processes for assigned customers of varying complexity.                         Resolve complicated participant billing questions as referred from the Call Center. Reconcile differences between billed and paid amounts from P&C group customers. Implement corrective actions, as needed, to ensure correct billing for P&C plan participants.                          Accountable for accurately applying premium from Institutional customers to the policies/accounts/records for each individual in a timely fashion.                         Identify quickly problems with the electronic interface established for the customer; troubleshoot problems with any of the ever-changing types of electronic interfaces employed; and mobilize the resources of other departments to resolve the technical interface/systems problems that arise.                         Lead the team assigned to implement a new customer s Billing & Remittance standard cases and complex cases.                         Assist in coordinating internal resources needed to implement product additions, to adjust for customer mergers/acquisitions and to accommodate customer changes in pay frequency, reorganizations, etc.                          Participate in analyzing escalated problems, issues and/or inquiries from group customers, Sales Execs, brokers and other units within Met (e.g., Call Center) on the B&R assist Senior Representative, Supervisor and/or Management in developing solutions/responses.                          Proactively perform functions that are critical to the accuracy of the billing of the B&R for all assigned accounts; (annually updating account billing schedules, daily analysis of reports that document missed or incorrect deductions, audit the accuracy of the content of administrative systems, etc.) in order to prevent serious administrative problems and customer service issues. Bill schedule project/audit should be part of this process                         Educate customers on the operational aspects of their B&R, including decision-support for both the group and individual employee level.                         Assist in contributing to the development of new processes and procedures.                         Mentor new Account Reps. and other Account Reps. on entry level topics.                        Pre-requisite skill sets                 Education -College (Graduation). For specific qualification, please specify.             Bachelors Degree (Any Stream)                 Specialized Skill-sets Required - Please specify                 MS-Word/ Excel

column2: Job Description: We are currently seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Junior Associate to join our team in the FMCG industry. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing various operational tasks including dispatch reconciliation, sales invoice processing, and production entry. This is an immediate opening for a candidate with a Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com) qualification and excellent communication skills. Responsibilities: 1. Handle day-to-day dispatch reconciliation activities, ensuring accuracy and completeness of records. 2. Process dispatch sales invoices in a timely and accurate manner, adhering to company policies and procedures. 3. Record production entries efficiently to maintain updated records of inventory levels and production activities. 4. Collaborate with internal teams such as logistics, production, and finance to ensure smooth operations and timely resolution of issues. 5. Assist in inventory management tasks including stocktaking, stock reconciliation, and maintaining stock records. 6. Generate reports on dispatch activities, sales invoices, and production entries for management review. 7. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal controls related to dispatch and production operations. 8. Provide support to the finance team during audits by preparing necessary documentation and assisting with audit inquiries. 9. Communicate effectively with stakeholders including suppliers, distributors, and internal teams to address queries and resolve issues. 10. Continuously identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency enhancement in dispatch and production operations. Requirements: 1. Bachelor's degree in Commerce (B.Com) or a related field. 2. Proven experience of 1-2 years in operations, preferably in the FMCG industry. 3. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey information clearly and effectively. 4. Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and reconciliation tasks. 5. Proficiency in MS Office applications, particularly Excel for data analysis and reporting. 6. Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment. 7. Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. 8. Adaptability and willingness to take on new challenges and responsibilities as needed. 9. Knowledge of inventory management principles and procedures is an advantage. 10. Immediate availability to join the team is preferred.

column2: This role is required for E&M Billing Processing in E-Palm also responsible for the Preparation of MIS reports for status on the E&M Invoice on monthly basis. Managing E&M invoices pertaining to all Opex and Capex (PO and Non-PO). Verifying the Contractors invoices with PO conditions, GST components and Accounting the SRIR/GRIR in SAP. Coordinating with procurement, users, and payment team resolving the disputes pertaining to vendor payment. Maintaining and updating the AMC/CMC details of the ongoing E&M Contracts 2. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES (List the responsibilities/ duties associated with the job and the major activities associated with each responsibility. For each responsibility/ duty listed, give the factors on which an individuals performance is judged) Accountabilities Major Activities E&M Billing Processing  Knowledge on E-Palm Invoice payment process for OPEX & CAPEX. Follow up User department to verify the bills and upload the supporting documents in e-palm. Further approval from user department, we need to verify the parameters and uploaded documents in the e-palm Further need to create a GRN in SAP. Need to verify the PO in SAP, before doing GRN. Quantity shortage needs to be monitored for all Energy and Water POs. Need to co-ordinate with user team, procurement, and finance for any update in PO. Further GRN, we must upload the GRN copy and give our approvals in e-Palm. Need follow-ups and co-ordinations with CC head, HOD and finance team for timely approval of the bills in e-palm. column2: Voluntary billing-P&C Account rep., is accountable for end to end billing management for Billing & Remittance customers (P&C).                      Facilitate a working dialog with Group contacts, stateside account managers, remittance team and internal business partners in order to provide solutions to the client billing needs.                        Essential Functions                          Build and maintain strong relationships with group customers and Internal Partners (Sales, I/T, or systems, marketing, call centers, accounting, etc.). in order to enhance the ongoing success of the B&R beginning at the time of sale.                          Monitor the billing, transmission and payment processes for assigned customers of varying complexity.                          Resolve complicated participant billing questions as referred from the Call Center. Reconcile differences between billed and paid amounts from P&C group customers. Implement corrective actions, as needed, to ensure correct billing for P&C plan participants.                          Accountable for accurately applying premium from Institutional customers to the policies/accounts/records for each individual in a timely fashion.                          Identify quickly problems with the electronic interface established for the customer; troubleshoot problems with any of the ever-changing types of electronic interfaces employed; and mobilize the resources of other departments to resolve the technical interface/systems problems that arise.                          Lead the team assigned to implement a new customer s Billing & Remittance standard cases and complex cases.                          Assist in coordinating internal resources needed to implement product additions, to adjust for customer mergers/acquisitions and to accommodate customer changes in pay frequency, reorganizations, etc.                          Participate in analyzing escalated problems, issues and/or inquiries from group customers, Sales Execs, brokers and other units within Met (e.g., Call Center) on the B&R assist Senior Representative, Supervisor and/or Management in developing solutions/responses.                          Proactively perform functions that are critical to the accuracy of the billing of the B&R for all assigned accounts; (annually updating account billing schedules, daily analysis of reports that document missed or incorrect deductions, audit the accuracy of the content of administrative systems, etc.) in order to prevent serious administrative problems and customer service issues. Bill schedule project/audit should be part of this process                          Educate customers on the operational aspects of their B&R, including decision-support for both the group and individual employee level. column1: Urgent hiring going on For Billing Executive
column2: Job Summary: The Billing Executive is responsible for managing the entire billing process for the company. This includes preparing invoices, ensuring timely and accurate billing, resolving billing discrepancies, and maintaining billing records. The role requires attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with other departments to ensure smooth financial operations. Key Responsibilities: Invoice Preparation and Issuance: Generate and issue accurate invoices to clients based on contracts and service agreements. Verify billing data, including customer information, product and service codes, and pricing. Billing Process Management: Ensure timely billing cycles and adherence to deadlines. Monitor accounts receivable and follow up on overdue invoices. Discrepancy Resolution: Investigate and resolve billing discrepancies and disputes in a professional manner. Coordinate with internal departments (e.g., Sales, Customer Service) to clarify and rectify billing issues. Record Keeping and Reporting: Maintain comprehensive billing records and documentation. Prepare regular reports on billing activities, revenue, and outstanding balances. Customer Communication: Respond to customer inquiries regarding billing issues, payments, and account balances. Provide excellent customer service to enhance customer satisfaction and retention. Compliance and Standards: Ensure all billing activities comply with company policies, accounting standards, and relevant laws. Stay updated on industry best practices and changes in billing regulations. Education: Bachelors degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field. Experience: Proven experience as a Billing Executive or in a similar role, preferably in [industry specific, e.g., healthcare, telecommunications, etc.]. Familiarity with billing software and accounting systems (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP, Oracle). Skills: Strong numerical and analytical skills. Excellent attention to detail and accuracy. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook). Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to handle confidential information with integrity. Preferred Qualifications: Certification in billing or accounting (e.g., Certified Billing Specialist). Experience with automated billing systems. Knowledge of [specific industry] regulations and compliance requirements. Working Conditions: Full-time position. Project site environment. Occasional overtime may be required during peak billing cycles.
column11: Billing, Preparing Invoices, Invoicing, Bill Processing
